column4: I just added an ATI Radeon x300 PCI-e graphics card to my system. Can someone point me to the documentation on how to get it going? Searching Google didn't produce.
Specifically, I'm looking to use the card's S-Video out to my TV
I assume you mean Display. I'm on 9.10. Nothing shows but my primary onboard graphics.
I tried xrandr --auto, but it didn't show anything. I'll try grandr, but I am fairly familiar with the CLI, if that's more efficient.
see this wiki it has the xrandr incantations to S-Video
Would I need to install the proprietary driver for radeon?
no; that is not possible for a X300 afaik
checked the logs around the time transmission dies ?
switch10_, I'll try checking both. Have to restart my system to get the process to die. Thanks.
can you boot a livecd on the machine? to see how the partitions on the disk are; check them if needed etc ...?
easy fix depends on what is the problem
Since it's hitting the BusyBox shell, I imagine that the root partition is fine. I'll boot a LiveCD and check each partition, but I think it's probably that some config file got corrupted.
i would help to know what error makes grub or the kernel drop to busybox
